pullRequest.title: Add new changelog
pullRequest.bodyText:
Replaces the old changelog with a new changelog conforming to the
"keep-a-changelog" standard, along with convenient links for seeing
which commits are included in each release. Adds a helper script for
updating the changelog and adding links as necessary.
The process to update the changelog is now as follows:

For ALL changes, add entries under the "Unreleased" heading.
If bumping the project version (i.e. releasing a new version), run the script at ./scripts/update-changelog to insert a new heading and update links accordingly.

We should try to keep the changelog "semantic" and consumer-facing, meaning that we shouldn't just copy-paste commit messages. We should explicitly mention what behavior has changed and what APIs have changed.

nodes.bodyText: Does this mean user should bump the version in gradle.properties before running this?  If so, document that.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,9 @@
+Usage: ./scripts/bump-changelog [OPTION]...
+Moves everything under the "Unreleased" heading of the changelog to a new version heading based on the version number

commit.message:
Add new changelog

Replaces the old changelog with a new changelog conforming to the
"keep-a-changelog" standard, along with convenient links for seeing
which commits are included in each release. Adds a helper script for
updating the changelog and adding links as necessary. Also adds a check
in the Travis build script to ensure that it's updated.
